text: Ah cool :slightly_smiling_face: can't you just remove the last part of the conditional then (&& @Frame <= 160) or am I missing something? Since you are meeting the conditions of the dot product, the points outside the circular trajectory will be picked up anyway. Or, not sure how exactly data storage is done in Houdini, but you could append the point ids that have gone through the if condition into a list to keep track of them and then update them after the frame is 160

I can't delete frame condition because I need to make an attack only during those frames ;/ Actually it's a good idea to make list, it's sad that in VEX you can't make functions, so I am not sure how to add them to groups and then change an attribute for that group, but I will definately going to try it ! Thank you :slightly_smiling_face:
Let me know how that goes! I'll still give it a think
